data.text:
NEW YORK - Queens County to Yates County

​Additional Information can be Found At:

Congressional Medal of Honor - http://www.cmohs.org/

Faces of Valor, Honor the Fallen - http://projects.militarytimes.com/valor/

Historical Marker Database - http://www.hmdb.org//

Iraqi Casualties - http://icasualties.org/OEF/USCasualtiesByState.aspx

Memorial Day Foundation - http://www.memorialdayfoundation.org/

New York Architecture - http://www.nyc-architecture.com/TEN/TEN-Monuments.htm

New York City Parks (Used with Permission - Permission does not constitute endorsement of this site.) http://www.nycgovparks.org/art-and-antiquities/permanent-art-and-monuments/results?search_text=War+Memorial&borough=&googleClientId=689238403.1452028265 Note: Strong encouragement is given to explore the New York City Parks website. So many more Memorials and Monuments to other heroes who were not involved in wartime efforts like firemen, policemen, priests, ordinary citizens, etc., are described and documented in detail.

New York Division of Veterans' Affairs - http://www.veterans.ny.gov/

New York Korean War Casualties - http://www.vetfriends.com/memorial/mem_alphab.cfm?war_id=3&page_id=1&states_id=34

New York Vietnam War Casualties - http://www.vetfriends.com/memorial/mem_alphab.cfm?war_id=4&page_id=1&states_id=34

Old Fort Niagara - http://www.oldfortniagara.org/history

US World War I Casualty Records - https://familysearch.org/learn/wiki/en/United_States_World_War_I_Casualty_Records

New York City - Understanding locations in New York City can be challenging. The city is divided into five boroughs. Those five boroughs are further divided into neighborhoods. It is the goal of this site to provide as accurate as possible, the locations of the Memorials, Monuments, and Makers. The boroughs will be listed with the associated county and, if needed, subdivided by neighborhoods. NOTE: Although as many neighborhoods as possible are listed for the boroughs, not all neighborhoods have listings for Memorials, Monuments, or Markers.

Queens (Located entirely on Long Island) - Queens County - Northwestern Queens (Astoria, Long Island City, Sunnyside); Northeastern Queens (Bayside, Bellerose, College Point, Douglastown, Flushing, Pomonok, Floral Park, Fresh Meadows, Fort Totten, Glen Oaks, Kew Gardens Hills, Little Neck, Whitestone); Central Queens (Corona, East Elmhurst, Elmhurst, Forest Hills, Fresh Pond, Glendale, Jackson Heights, Kew Gardens, Maspeth, Middle Village, Rego Park, Ridgewood, Woodside); Southeastern Queens (Bellaire, Brookville, Cambria Heights, Hollis Hills, Hollis, Jolliswood, Jamaica, Jamaica Estates, Jamaica Hills, Laurelton, Meadowmere, Queens Village, Rochdale Village, Rosedale, Saint Albans, South Jamaica, Springfield Gardens, Warnerville); Southwestern Queens (The Hole, Howard Beach, Ozone Park, Richmond Hill, Woodhaven); The Rockaways (Arverne, Bayswater, Belle Harbor, Breezy Point, Broad Channel, Edgemere, Far Rockaway, Hammels, Neponsit, Rockaway Beach, Rockaway Park, Roxbury, Seaside)

Staten Island - Richmond County​ ​- Annadale, Arden Heights, Arlington, Arrochar, Bay Terrace, Bloomfield, Brighton Beach, Bulls Head, Castleton, Castleton Corners, Charleston, Chelsea, Clifton, Concord, Dongan Hills, Egbertville, Elm Park, Eltington, Emerson Hill, Fort Wadsworth, Graniteville, Grant City, Greenridge, Grymes Hill, Hamilton Park, Heartland Village, Huguenot, Lighthouse Hill, Livingston, Manor Heights, Mariners Harbor, Meiers Corners Midland Beach, New Brighton, New Drop, New Springville, Oakwood, Ocean Breeze, Old Place, Old Town, Pleasant Plains, Port Richmond, Prince's Bay, Randall Manor, Richmond Valley, Richmondtown, Rosebank, Rossville, Sandy Ground, Shore Acres, Silver Lake, South Beach, St. George, Stapleton, Stapleton Heights, Sunnyside, Todt Hill, Tompkinsville, Tottenville, Tottenville Beach, Travis, Ward Hill, Westerleigh, West new Brighton, Willowbrook, Woodrow

Counties of Cities/Towns Represented (continued)​

*Underlined Cities do not serve as links

Please click on the county listed below to be directed to that county. Congressional Medal of Honor Recipients are listed on the New York - Albany Co to Putnam Co page.Access to some pictures is different for this page. Some links are present after the name of the city that corresponds with the pictures and it will redirect you to the New York - Albany Co to Putnam Co page. Other pictures will be at the bottom of this page and grouped according to county.
